Replies.Reply: Now we end the debate about tactics... and begin to plan for victory.
My own subjects condemn me! They dare judge me? And what emboldens this treachery?...
He cuckolds me in my castle, rapes my precious Queen! This is a low, conniving God... But I have bested him on this day and humbled the great Prime.
Tell me, Panos, who rivals Zeus on Olympos? Who does the Fearless One fear?
Tell me what the Priests say!
Yes, Tiamat! And today I have honored her.
I've taken Zeus' whore and the bastard she grows in her belly and thrown them to Tiamat in her rough sea!
I honor Zeus' rival with all that was dear to me --
-- and commit double murder in her honor...
so that Zeus will know I despise and disdain him and spit on his foul name!
My King! Has the strategy been set so quickly?
Come to your Queen, my King.
I beg you, Your Highness -- Acrisius pulls a dagger and holds it to the Steward's throat.
Tiamat... Tiamat, Queen of the Deep.
Those who dare, whisper she covets Zeus' throne and schemes to achieve it, the ambitious Goddess of the Dark Oceans...
-- in an instant, the apparition blows past them -- wind and dust whip at them. In awe and fear --
Thoth the Quick...
Messenger of the Gods. Bound for Olympos.
My lord.
You are correct, Your Highness, I do the bidding of Zeus...
... as do all Gods... and all men.
King Kepheus, as humble messenger of Zeus, I've come to talk of peace.
Zeus above all. He has so long desired the tragedy end, he made a plan that began twenty-five years ago.
Beauteous Queen, let Thoth limn for you the forethought and wisdom of Zeus, God of Gods.
You have a daughter of age.
No. Such a union would be unclean. Years ago Zeus created a scion of mixed blood. Half-man, half-God. Bred for just this union. That is how important Zeus considers this truce.
A prince, of both Olympian and Human royalty. A chosen one.
Zeus has given his son to the cause of peace.
You have my word, as Ambassador of the Gods.
The Princessa shall not be harmed.
We have debated, we have voted, and it is decided. We offer the Humans peace. Thoth, you will take them the terms of a treaty --
Silence! Or learn what it is to be afraid! The debate is over, the votes cast...
We guarantee an armistice, we shield the bridegroom and the Joppan royal family.
And we do not interfere in their actions. We leave them undisturbed unless-invoked by name to enter their affairs.
They have suffered terrible losses. They will not pass up a chance for peace.
Why do we have to play these games, my lovely girl? You know you cannot leave.
It has just begun. Have you forgotten your place in this?
I still believe in you. Close your eyes and see your tomorrow.
You you already involved. Such is fate. We cannot hide from the .trials of our future... no matter how dark the alleyway.
Am I to understand you do not intend to make this union with the Queen Andromeda?
Despite my will and intention that you do so?
Would you choose to condemn Men, your own people, to suffer more of this devastating War?
Do you reproach Zeus?
Does that absolve you suddenly of your responsibilities?
What will you do, Man of free will?
So... my Son, you will be a pawn for love?
A treaty!
We don't negotiate with them! We dictate to them. Their place is to beg. They have forgotten their role and have denied us the sustenance of their prayers.
They will bow down when we snap their backs! Mercy? We are Gods!
Soon enough, Set. Zeus has grown weaker than I knew.
We will manage these thick-witted Humans to our own ends.
Yes, we will be bound by great Zeus' rules... until their fragile membranes tear. We dare not interfere with these insects...
but we may be invited to intervene.
In this chamber Zeus defiled the Queen Danae and begat the anointed demigod, who would facilitate this foul truce.
The King who stood against Zeus and was crushed for it, though he was not the offender. But this is not his former home...
What form of monster do you visit upon Perseus?
My Servant, your lonely solitude now ends... It's time to leave.
You have blasphemed powers beyond understanding... You, a stupid braying goat before the unfathomable galaxies. You dare put this frivolous, scrawny slut...
above the infinite Goddess of the Deep!
Look upon the sublime and know your error. You'll not blink.
People of Joppa, hear me. For the sacrilege of this arrogant creature, I will loose Leviathan upon you.
I'm not finished. Hold your gaze.
For thirty days, Joppa shall suffer the scorn of Leviathan.
Unless... Instant silence.
This is my will, Joppa.
The demigod and his retinue are joined. They march for the counsel of the Norn Sisters, to seek the frailty of my Leviathan.
Yes. I beseech you, track the expedition.
That, we cannot have. I merely suggest that the road to Skolothia is hazardous.
My loyal friend. it is beneath you to stalk this band of infidels one by one. Events demand more decisive action.
Yes, Kalibos, the time is nigh when I restore you to your rightful form -- proud Acrisius.
How did he do this? They were not even to reach Medusa.
Spare me your pitiful maundering!
Then there shall be no rules!
I am your ally. That is all you need to know. Bloody your hands and rid me of this pestilence.
Loyal servants...
You have sown the seeds of revolt.
The hour of sacrifice is upon us.
Our mercy will give them reason to be grateful. They will bow down and whisper our names with more passion than before.
And if they refuse our terms?
Tiamat, I know this place, but I know not why.
The Sisters...
To plainly thwart them would betray our intentions and draw the wrath of Zeus and the others.
Hear me, my pet. Let my instructions be seared to your primal mind as natural law.
You are starving. Your gut says you'll soon perish. No earthly meat will still that hunger. What you need, what you ache for, is the flesh of... a demigod!
I meant only that the demigod bends the path without knowing it.
You have liberated me, my Queen.
The emissary approaches. Take your time in your responses, debate nothing...
None like this.
I only recommend you take care with the tone of the conversation.

Thoth the Quick, I am Amoun, the King's Magi Strategos. We welcome you with humility, honored by your visit from the realm of the Gods. The King shoots Amoun a look, but he is still shaken by Thoth's sudden appearance. Cassiopeia tries to recover her composure.
Majesty, if I may -- the young man does exist. He lives in a small fishing village on the isle of Seriphos.
My Queen, I serve only the great order of things. I was the boy's tutor years ago.
Your Majesty...
I know this mentor who so influences young Perseus.
Porpoise... You've grown tall and strong since my departure. Perseus laughs at his old nickname and holds Amoun at arm's length.
I am honored to serve the King as an advisor. His Magi Strategos.
And a celebration of the treaty.
Perhaps the thought of her new life has made her frantic to enjoy the vestiges of her old one.
Follow the lights and the sound of profane music.
. Leviathan -- First dweller of the deep. Hewn by Tiamat from the dark blood of the earth...
. All monsters of the sea are but shadows of Leviathan the Kraken -- colossal, rapacious, and nigh indestructible.
No... We need only the will to do it.
You're 'listening'? We're talking about the precious life of your betrothed.
Exactly! A newcomer with a fresh perspective. Share your thoughts with the King, your future father-
Majesty, we can seek the counsel of the Norn Sisters of Skolothia.
My King, with your permission...
I'll give you a map and much more.
. we'll join the Cleon desert legion, the most formidable unit in all the army... With their escort, we can safely reach our destination in Skolothia, which lies to the east...
Our guides will be Mongke and Tamburlane, father and son monster hunters from the Kingdom of the Iron Horde.
Our escort will be a detachment of the Praetorian Guard, led by Commander Draco -- the staunchest security force in Joppa. Next, on a stunning pale horse, a pale rider -- the Wilting Girl.
I thank the stars we have her. Besides, she takes her orders from an authority much greater than I.
No matter what you believe, Porpoise, some things are fated.
Your birth was written in the stars. I sought you out and took it as my cause to teach you.
Concentrate on the task before you. All answers will come with that.
. They've been chasing Djinn Raiders in the mountains for years.
Yes, Godly zealots, supposedly insane. They fight like Hades himself is keeping score...
.. That's how the Desert Legion came to be called 'God-slayers.' I'm not ashamed to say I'll be relieved to have their protection the rest of the way...
You wanted to know about Djinn Raiders. Here they are.
Muster to me!
Come on! You can pass through!
Only humans can penetrate the shield!
No! It's too late for her!
Have you learned nothing? If you break out now, we're all at risk.
Because of you. You're the reason they saved us.
Why don't you ask him?
They have no mouths. That doesn't mean they do not speak.
The Pillar of Moirai. Lair of the Norn Sisters.
They're witches in the form of Strix. Not a pleasant sight, a Strix. They have powerful magic and dreadful habits. Baby-eaters, among other things.
But they owe me a favor. When the war broke out, they lent their power to men against the Gods in exchange for infant sacrifice.
Yes. They have to take turns. If they all could see at once, they would be invincible, which one cannot risk in beings so grotesque.
Likewise, Urd. I seek your counsel.
Surely the beast from the sea has some weakness. You owe me this answer at least.
No, good Sisters... the son of Zeus.
You know the answer sure as you already knew the question.
They're lying, Perseus.

Medusa was a tender young woman once -- a mortal creature of such rare beauty as to tempt even the Gods. One night, on the road home, she caught the eye of the God of Deserts and Entropy -- Set the Void.
She hastened to hallowed ground, thinking the Goddess Tiamat would protect her in her temple. But the God Set followed.
He ravished her on the cold floor.
Despoiled and broken in the shadow of Tiamat's altar, she prayed for comfort and pleaded for courage...
Charon's ferry.
Medusa must have turned them to stone.
Jove the Father is another name by which Zeus was known. This milestone dates from when city states were named for their patron deities.
'The Polis of Jove Pater' is the ancient name of --
Yes, Joppa... once the most sacred site in the worship of Jove.
. and transforms Joppa into the new church of Tiamat. The ancient abode of Zeus...
We should stop for the night.
We all need rest. If you don't save yourself, you'll have nothing left when you face the Kraken.
Why don't we stop here tonight? Spyros smiles, looking off after Perseus.
This is my fault. I've permitted .this infatuation to progress too far.
Are you so selfish? Would you risk everything for the foolish love of --
I've received ambassadors before.
I'm not cowed. If these arrogant Gods are so powerful, why are they the ones seeking a truce?
In my palace, I decide how the discourse proceeds, not some messenger sent on errands by Zeus.
A treaty marriage?
Surely Zeus does not ask a mortal father to give his daughter to a God.
I have heard of no such demigod.
You knew about this and said nothing?
How haughty this boy must be, who knows he is half-God.
With our daughter's future at stake, we do not bestow trust easily.
If any harm should come to her --
Of course... of course your word is unquestioned here.
Where is the lucky young suitor?
It will take more than half-a-God to handle her.
. before I am a king or a peacemaker, I am a father. Do you know what that means?
-- and all so she could be thrust into a momentous conflict... of which she knows nothing at all.
I take no comfort in that, young man. In fact, I find little to take comfort in here. You are a stranger from a distant place, and I am asked to entrust the welfare of my daughter to you.
If you are not kind and patient with her, if any harm of any kind should come her way, I will have your head on a stake.
Is this amusing to you?
Does a truce in the war between Men and Gods not strike you as a higher purpose?
This is supposed to be the son of a God, yet he doubts their existence!
Cassiopeia! We have agreed such talk has no place in this palace.
Where does a young person get such ideas?
Where is Andromeda? At the least, the two should meet before tomorrow's ceremony...
It seems our Andromeda has wandered away.
Perseus, if you're to take the wild girl for a wife, this is a good time to start your training.
Leviathan awakes...

My Queen lies near death. Am I now to choose between the survival of our state... and the life of Andromeda, my only child? Amoun watches Perseus, at the fringe of the group, expectantly. But Perseus looks only perplexed, an observer.
Do you tell me only what you think I wish to hear!
The citizens of Joppa are fighting for their lives. Would you have me gamble the city to save one girl?
I thought this boy's father was a God. How does a stranger walk unmolested into the Throne Room of the King?
Help him with what?
But how?
With what army? I dare not weaken our forces when the city is about to be besieged.
The relief fleet is lost.
From your lips, I pray, to his true father's ear.
They take refuge from the Lower Wharf. A sight I wish you'd never seen.
Listen to me. By the time this is over, your mother and I may well be gone. But I guarantee the day is coming when Joppa will know glory under Queen Andromeda.
Twenty-five years! How is that possible?
Andromeda!
Is my only daughter to marry a demigod, not of this earth?
Just which king do you serve?
What assurance do we have that our daughter will be safe?
Peshet!
Where is the Princess?
Tell the Princess -- should you find her -- her father and I want to see her at once. She stalks away. Urgently, through the door --
She'll be a great ruler one day.
I'm sure she's preparing herself to make the best possible impression.
They exist, young man. But if you doubt their power, I join you --
The wedding comes later. Tomorrow we will have the public announcement.
She is unmistakable.
I won't be long-winded. You all know I am a modest person, no matter my rank.
This is not a celebration of a betrothal...
not the celebration of the happiness of two parents, or of our good people.
This union represents new hope for a lasting peace! That is the only cause for celebration.
My sweet Andromeda... grown into a fine young woman, confident and sure. Look at her! Isn't she beautiful?
To my beautiful daughter... more beautiful than all the women of Joppa. More beautiful than the Gardens of Nineveh...
More beautiful than the turquoise ocean and its sublime Goddess of the Deep... Tiamat herself! My daughter is a beauty even a Goddess must envy.
I've gone on too long --

PERSEUS,                                                    25, wiry, bronzed from the sun, a stubbled jaw, a knife in his teeth. He swims with the power and grace of a porpoise -- beyond the ability of any normal man.
PERSEUS AND PEGASUS descending. Perseus sees Andromeda splash down and get pulled under.
Your grieving does Anteros no good. It comforts only you.
He was careless with the net.
The Gods delude themselves about their power and watch in envy while we act. We make our own history.
What you do, no other man can do.
Purpose! Looking for purpose is what ensnares men in the superstition of the Gods, as surely as your friend was caught in that net. And all the searching leads down to the same place.
You are still a man, confined by man's limits. You are just as likely to fail as succeed.
Ordinary men fail most of the time.
Your mother can explain. She believes everything has an explanation, even if we have to make it up.
It's one of the reasons I love you, Marmara.
If you consider superstition, fear and darkness good things...
Learning, science... love.
-- as lions hunger for blood.
The Gods were desperate to claim our awe again.
Yes, even the Gods. If they could not earn our faith with love, they would demand it with fear.
I am far from young and have seen much of the world... and I agree with my son.
With whatever is needed...
Yes. Give us a map. Amoun laughs. When some of the others join in, the   King gives them a look that stops them dead.
Who would have thought we'd be on a journey like this? Two simple fishermen.
Living at the mercy of the sea so long has convinced me some adventures are unexpected and some dangers unavoidable. It's all in your attitude.
The Kraken is just another big fish.
Draco, tell me what this --
It's no wonder they shy away from all strangers.
Stay away from my boy!
Tell us now!
Nothing.
A look I know well.
Never before.
In my own mirror, son.
If we're lucky... never.
I go with my boy.
Perseus, I think she's hit!
Near to the left!
Perseus... I don't hear her near me!
Eleven stadia to the South... What is 'Polis of Jove Pater'? I'm ignorant of this.
Yes, the evidence is everywhere once we leave our island. That's why I so rarely leave. These Gods, what do you make of them?
Yes, as bad as men.
And would you have that sort guide your life?
If we don't rest the horses, they won't make it to Joppa.
If it should come to pass, tell your mother and sister I loved them much.
The sacrifice has begun.
How? They all look at what separates them from the city --
No shit.
It's my fault he's gone.
So it's his fault. Not mine, not fate, not the Gods?
Now my history is I let my friend die in my arms. I made it back, why couldn't he?
To what purpose? I failed him.
You always say that my abilities are greater than other men's. But they were not enough to save him.
How is that greater than other men?
self-determination! Those things that give Man dignity and independence.
You... I saw you watching our boat at the cliff.
Can I be of service?
Right now?
It wouldn't take much persuading to get me to leave this village, but tonight is impossible. My family can't wake and find me gone. Where do you want me to go?
Come back in the morning and we can talk about it.
For what?
How long have I been out?
I had a dream. I fell into a dark pit. I thought I would never stop falling. But a beam of light formed a soft net, caught me and tossed me back.
When I came back up to the world, a beautiful woman appeared and spoke to me. But as she spoke she would sometimes disappear into the whiteness with a strange sound.
When I could hear her, she spoke nonsense. She said that my father was a God and my mother a --
I am an ordinary man.
None of that means anything.
A good trick. You must be the demigod, not me.
A Chthonian?
And when none worship you?
And demigods, where do they stand in your hierarchy?
If demigods rank so low, why do you need me?
What!
Who, me?
Forget it.
And just who exactly am I supposed to marry?
I don't think so.
That's what I'm doing.
What are they celebrating?
I'm not sure, Your Highness. I did not know my father.
She's not the only one, sir. I don't know much about the events for which I've been drafted.
Not even a little, my lord. It's just that I myself was waylaid --
I've been told I'm to play a part in events which serve a higher purpose... of which I'm not at all convinced.
With all respect, I have never seen a God. On my island, they're no more than a story.
I can only proceed based on what I have experienced, not on a faith I do not possess.
Perhaps from my adopted father, sir. I admire him greatly, and he believes in little he cannot hold in his hand.
Master Amoun!
From my village tutor to Magi Strategos... What a path!
Tomorrow? Is the wedding so soon?
How will I know her?
I'm a stranger here. Any hints?
Very beautiful.
I meant the sunset.
I know nothing of seduction. I'm a simple fisherman. My home is across that water.
To Joppa? I was kidnapped.
I've come to see my future wife.
Me either.
No one asked me. And now that I've met you, I don't know if I can go through with it.
It's not personal. Seeing you makes it real. I think a man should make his own decisions. I won't be the pawn of a King or a God.
I don't think it's going to be that simple.
I don't suppose I could escape without your aid.
One of the most beautiful women I've ever seen.
True. Maybe a lot of girls look like you.
What if we find we're very compat--
It seems what everyone wants to believe.
I didn't know how to get this outfit on.
Me either.
Tell who?
I know that I am young and have not seen much of the world, but it seems to me that nothing is indestructible.
Father, how did you find me?
He will help me destroy Leviathan.
We have thirty days to find its weakness.
We'll leave tonight.
Amoun, it seems an odd coincidence you came into my life as tutor, so long ago, and now, once again you instruct me.
I'm afraid I've dragged you into real danger, Father, when I have little idea of what I'm doing.
What's our attitude about destroying Leviathan?
Joppa is pummelled by the Dark Goddess.
By what name may mortals call you?
Who do your worshippers pray to?
Perhaps that is why they are falling in number?
I have to call you something...
Since we're naming you on this road, what about 'Via Dahlia'?
That's a pretty name. Wait, better yet -- 'Vidalia'? How's that... 'Vidalia'? That's more than pretty, beautiful really, just as you are.
You don't like it?
What's that? I missed it --
I'll find some more.
Now is when an honorable man would turn around and walk away...
. but they say I am not really a man.
Vidalia...
Then this will be a good way to find out just what I am.
I'm not the leader, Draco, Amoun is. I'm too young to start avoiding trouble.
I didn't beckon the Humbaba.
The monster killed my friend. I could not contain my rage. But you, Goddess, are aloof from the emotions of Men.
Master Amoun... You knew about me, didn't you? When you came to our village?
You chose a poor student. I have learned little and my mistakes cost dearly.
I do not believe my fate is to be half a God. No demigod could feel as confused as I do tonight.

No... Perseus. PERSEUS WHIPS OUT HIS SWORD. The whole Expedition comes to life as                                                 -- THE LOTOPHAGI ATTACK, swift and brutal. Long arms thrash and rip at the Praetorians.
Only humans...
Drop it, Amoun!
Take the barrier down or I'll go through it!
Get down!
Get ready to defend yourselves!
Vidalia... we need to help them...
But I thought the Djinn...
I thought they didn't speak.
Tell me of them.
You made only one eye?
Spyros, he means me no harm. The Shaikh lowers his hand: Spyros falls into the dirt.
I hear you and I understand you.
You are praying to me? There must be a mistake.
An offering'? I thank you and take it humbly, as agift from a friend, not an offering.
You honor my father? You honor Spyros?
Tell us what we want to know or your Eye has seen its last.
Since you cannot see, let me tell you what's about to happen. I'm about to throw this evil Eye to the rocks far below. I fear its journey will be a taxing one.
You don't have to tell us the secret. But you will have to live as blind as she made you.
Tell me first. If I like the answer, you get your Eye.
I believe them.
Here's your second sight.
And Medusa! Where does she abide?
How can she be slain?
If ever I should meet him.
I need a light.
You're enjoying this too much.
I wish it, but I can't perceive the world that way.
I'm beginning to hear the wind.
Wait...
What?
What do you see?
From me?
Then where?
When does it go away?
I'm going into the Temple.
Of what?
Yes. You?
Where?
-- Joppa.
Tiamat chooses the city of Zeus to take hostage.
She compels the people to make human sacrifice of the Princess Andromeda...
Father, we've seen much on this journey we cannot hold in our hands. Yet these things are real enough. At each turn, we find monsters and Gods.
No. Men must be accountable to themselves. Otherwise we serve poor masters.
We must keep moving. Time is running out.
Vidalia!
Who were they?
I was mad with fear. I was no hero. I just didn't want to die.
What is this?
How long do you have?
What will happen?
What about me?
When you vanish, I'll find you.
I'd rather look at you.
I won't marry Andromeda.

I am half God... and now is the time... Perseus rises. He cocks his arm and clobbers Set with an ear-splitting CRACK OF THUNDER and a sparking BURST OF WHITE ENERGY. Set drops Vidalia and lurches back, aghast. BLACK BLOOD shoots from his mouth.
We must go quickly now.
The combat has just begun.
You'll have to tell them yourself.
Vidalia?
May we all have a good ride today!
Hello.
Are you all right?
Are you ready to become a queen?
Then you're ready to go home.
Yes.
Yes.
I have no people. You have stranded me between realms, neither man nor God.
No. I thank you... Father.
You have freed me. I will not be a pawn for Men or Gods.
You've made me understand that my responsibility is to myself. So it is with us all.
You've put me to a great test. In the midst of it, I found the courage in my heart to defy Gods.
It matters not. Whatever the source, I are only grateful.
This war will end the moment you choose for it to end... and Men agree. I think, perhaps, that is the free will that all realms share.
I'm going to find Vidalia.
Yes, Father, gladly.
TWO STONE STATUES flank the entrance: a pair of enormous CENTAURS -- NESSUS and IXION, their eyelids sewn shut.
Mother wants you to come in for supper.
Perseus, why are you so sad?
I still don't understand.
Tell me! Why is there war between Man and the Gods?
What things?
Desperate... the Gods?
At the beginning of time, when Man was young, he prayed to the Gods.
But Man grew, as children do, and he turned away from the Gods. Be began to put his faith in other things.
But what of the Gods, who had protected and guided us so long?
Spyros!
Your father's mind is closed on these matters.
And that is how war broke out between Man and Gods.
Now eat your dinner, which the Gods -- and your father -- have provided.
It was not the boat I was watching.
Yes, of service. I need you to come with me on a journey.
It's not what I want. I am in the service of others.
I'm sorry.
This time? Only a few hours. The time before, almost a day. How was your rest?
You are special, Perseus. Your birth was ordained for this very purpose.
Do you ever lie awake during a storm and listen to the thunder?
And it sounds as though it matches the beating of your heart?
How long can you hold your breath?
Look at your arms, Perseus.
I'm a Chthonian.
An Earth Goddess.
The Gods have a caste system just as men do. The Olympians are our nobility -- few but cosmic. The Chthonians are the peasants. Our abode is this earth, and we exist as long as men worship us.
We fade away.
Nowhere. Sorry.
For a marriage.
Zeus, God of Gods, has proposed a treaty to end the war. At the center is the marriage of a mortal with a demigod.
Zeus himself has chosen you. A demigod may be less than a God, but he's more than a Man. One foot in Humanity, the other in Divinity. Your marriage will be a symbol of accord between our races.
Such a union could save millions of souls.
You're looking in the wrong direction.
Perhaps you should give some thought to your immediate future.
Maybe you should take another look...
You.
Zeus?
My part is finished.
As I've lost my believers, the future has become dimmer to me.
It's too painful. I can't involve myself.
It will not stop. Tiamat knows no mercy.
I have no name.
I can't remember.
I do not object.

We SEE that she is also watching Perseus, who is sleeping in a makeshift bed in the bottom of the boat. Her eyes slowly travel over his bronzed, muscled frame. There are bite marks on his legs and arms, but they seem to be healing as we look at them.
Do you think you can manhandle a Princess this way?
As though she was hungry and needy as you, a mere servant?
very mistaken... a woman of my station... never be attracted...
The Princess is not here.
Find another... Princess.
To please you, I would submit to such a marriage... except I would rather die; Please let me know you're serious about this perverse plan so I can make arrangements to kill myself.
What did you say?
Do you think just anyone can make intimate judgements on the royal family?
Do you always start a seduction with an insult?
What brings you here?
I mean here, tonight.
It's not personal. You're not a bad-looking boy.
I'm too young. I don't want to be married.
Then why are you doing it?
Since we agree, it's settled. No marriage.
That doesn't mean we can't be friends. Get to know each other.
I'll take care of you.
This is my special place. No one can see or hear or even find us now.
Do you want to?
Do you not find me attractive?
Of course, you haven't been much in the world.
Don't you want to make love to your almost-wife? Maybe we'll find we're not compatible.
Is it true you're a demigod?
I don't see it.
But let's find out for sure...
